channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Euro Stabilizes, Awaits Potential Chinese Stimulus
item.description: The euro has stabilized in the $1.09-$1.10 range against the dollar, and good news from China over the weekend could help build a floor at 1.09 early ...

item.title: 7-Eleven's parent company cuts full-year earnings forecast, presses ahead with restructuring
item.description: The news comes as the Japanese retail group resists a takeover attempt by Canada's Alimentation Couche-Tard.

item.title: The Fed is finally cutting rates, but banks aren't in the clear just yet
item.description: When the Federal Reserve cut its benchmark rate by half a percentage point last month, it boosted prospects for many banks.

item.title: Hurricane Damage and Your Taxes. Here's What to Know.
item.description: Losses from hurricanes, wildfires and other disasters may be tax deductible, and even those spared from catastrophe in 33 states may get extended tax ...

item.title: AMD's Second AI Act Faces a Tougher Crowd
item.description: Strong sales of the chipmaker’s first GPU chips still barely make a dent in Nvidia’s armor.

item.title: Delta sales guidance disappoints, CEO says airline expects lower demand around the election
item.description: Delta Air Lines expects to grow earnings in the fourth quarter, thanks to resilient travel demand and strong bookings for year-end holidays.

item.title: Obamacare Will Survive This Election---The Fight Will Be About Paying for It
item.description: Killing the Affordable Care Act would have massive repercussions, but that doesn’t make its inner workings untouchable.

item.title: GM expects 2025 earnings to be similar to this year's despite industry headwinds
item.description: The Detroit automaker's targeted adjusted earnings before interest and taxes this year is between $13 billion and $15 billion, or $9.50 and $10.50 per...

item.title: JPMorgan Chase is set to report third-quarter earnings – here's what the Street expects
item.description: JPMorgan will be watched closely for clues on how banks are faring at the start of the Federal Reserve's easing cycle.

item.title: Government Bonds Look Prone to Near-Term Weakness
item.description: Investors betting on bond weakness—with yields staying at current levels or even rising—have momentum on their side in the short term, LBBW said.
